title: EPISTOLAE Henriette Berger
html:
EPISTOLAE Henriette Berger

“They Don't Write English Like They Used To” [VERBATIM II, 3] suggests that they don't write French or German like they used to either. The pâté-mad Alsatians mentioned, if French-speaking, spell the name of their city Strasbourg. Those who are German-speaking spell it Strassburg. “Strassbourg” must be the Freutschais spelling. [Henriette Berger, Oberlin, Ohio]
